MXQerrors:
(: http://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-functions/#error-summary :)
ERROR: err:FOER0000
ERROR: err:FOAR0001: division by 0 is forbidden.
=ERROR: err:FOAR0002, Numeric operation overflow/underflow. ERROR: err:FOAR0001: division by 0 is forbidden.
ERROR: err:FOCA0001, Input value too large for decimal.
ERROR: err:FOCA0002, Invalid lexical value.
ERROR: err:FOCA0003, Input value too large for integer.
ERROR: err:FOCA0005, NaN supplied as float/double value.
ERROR: err:FOCA0006, String to be cast to decimal has too many digits of precision.
ERROR: err:FOCH0001, Code point not valid.
=ERROR: err:FOCH0002, Unsupported collation. error in function application: at (0,0-0,0): wrong number of arguments for function `...'\'' (expected ..., got ...)
ERROR: err:FOCH0003, Unsupported normalization form.
ERROR: err:FOCH0004, Collation does not support collation units.
ERROR: err:FODC0001, No context document.
=ERROR: err:FODC0002, Error retrieving resource. ERROR: I/O warning : failed to load external entity "..." ERROR: shred:mainSHREDDER: xmlCreateURLParserCtxt("...") failed ERROR: CMDshred2bats: operation failed. ERROR: interpret_params: +(param 2): evaluation error.
ERROR: err:FODC0003, Function stability not defined.
ERROR: err:FODC0004, Invalid argument to fn:collection.
=ERROR: err:FODC0005, Invalid argument to fn:doc. ERROR: I/O warning : failed to load external entity "..." ERROR: shred:mainSHREDDER: xmlCreateURLParserCtxt("...") failed ERROR: CMDshred2bats: operation failed. ERROR: interpret_params: +(param 2): evaluation error.
ERROR: err:FODT0001, Overflow/underflow in date/time operation.
ERROR: err:FODT0002, Overflow/underflow in duration operation.
ERROR: err:FODT0003, Invalid timezone value.
=ERROR: err:FONC0001, ??? illegal reference to context node: at (0,0-0,0): ``.'\'\'' is unbound
ERROR: err:FONS0004, No namespace found for prefix.
ERROR: err:FONS0005, Base-uri not defined in the static context.
=ERROR: err:FORG0001, Invalid value for cast/constructor. ERROR: err:FORG0001: could not cast value from ... to .... =type error: can'\''t cast type '\''...'\'' to type '\''...'\''
ERROR: err:FORG0002, Invalid argument to fn:resolve-uri().
=ERROR: err:FORG0003, fn:zero-or-one called with a sequence containing more than one item. =ERROR: err:FORG0003: function fn:zero-or-one expects at most one value. type error: no variant of function fn:zero-or-one accepts the given argument type(s): ... type error: maybe you meant: type error: fn:zero-or-one (node*) as node? type error: illegal arguments for function fn:zero-or-one
ERROR: err:FORG0004, fn:one-or-more called with a sequence containing no items.
=ERROR: err:FORG0005: function fn:exactly-one expects exactly one value. =ERROR: err:FORG0005, fn:exactly-one called with a sequence containing zero or more than one item. type error: no variant of function fn:exactly-one accepts the given argument type(s): ... type error: maybe you meant: type error: fn:exactly-one (node*) as node type error: illegal arguments for function fn:exactly-one
=ERROR: err:FORG0006, Invalid argument type. type error: no variant of function ... accepts the given argument type(s): ... type error: maybe you meant: type error: ... type error: illegal arguments for function ...
ERROR: err:FORG0008, Both arguments to fn:dateTime have a specified timezone.
ERROR: err:FORG0009, Error in resolving a relative URI against a base URI in fn:resolve-uri.
=ERROR: err:FORX0001, Invalid regular expression. flags ERROR: [pcre_replace]: 1 times inserted nil due to errors at tuples 0@0. ERROR: [pcre_replace]: first error was: ERROR: pcre_replace: "flags" contains invalid character '\''...'\'' ERROR: pcre_replace: operation failed.
ERROR: err:FORX0002, Invalid regular expression.
ERROR: err:FORX0003, Regular expression matches zero-length string.
ERROR: err:FORX0004, Invalid replacement string.
=ERROR: err:FOTY0011, ??? type error: no variant of function ... accepts the given argument type(s): ... type error: maybe you meant: type error: ... type error: illegal arguments for function ...
ERROR: err:FOTY0012, Argument node does not have a typed value.
(: http://www.w3.org/TR/xslt-xquery-serialization/#id-errors :)
ERROR: err:SENR0001, It is a error [err:SENR0001] if an item in S5 in sequence normalization is an attribute node or a namespace node.
ERROR: err:SERE0003, It is an error if the serializer is unable to satisfy the rules for either a well-formed XML document entity or a well-formed XML external general parsed entity, or both, except for contents modified by the character expansion phase of serialization.
ERROR: err:SEPM0004, It is an error to specify the doctype-system parameter, or to specify the standalone parameter with a value other than omit, if the instance of the data model contains text nodes or multiple element nodes as children of the root node.
ERROR: err:SERE0005, It is an error if the serialized result would contain an NCName Names that contains a character that is not permitted by the version of Namespaces in XML specified by the version parameter.
ERROR: err:SESU0006, ???
ERROR: err:SESU0006, It is an error if the serializer does not support the version of XML and the version of Namespaces in XML specified in the version parameter.
ERROR: err:SESU0007, It is an error if an output encoding other than UTF-8 or UTF-16 is requested and the serializer does not support that encoding.
ERROR: err:SERE0008, It is an error if a character that cannot be represented in the encoding that the serializer is using for output appears in a context where character references are not allowed (for example if the character occurs in the name of an element).
ERROR: err:SEPM0009, It is an error if the omit-xml-declaration parameter has the value yes, and the standalone attribute has a value other than omit; or the version parameter has a value other than 1.0 and the doctype-system parameter is specified.
ERROR: err:SEPM0010, It is an error if the output method is xml, the value of the undeclare-prefixes parameter is yes, and the value of the version parameter is 1.0.
ERROR: err:SESU0011, It is an error if the value of the normalization-form parameter specifies a normalization form that is not supported by the serializer.
ERROR: err:SERE0012, It is an error if the value of the normalization-form parameter is fully-normalized and any relevant construct of the result begins with a combining character.
ERROR: err:SESU0013, It is an error if the serializer does not support the version of HTML specified by the version parameter.
ERROR: err:SERE0014, It is an error to use the HTML output method when characters which are legal in XML but not in HTML, specifically the control characters #x7F-#x9F, appear in the instance of the data model.
ERROR: err:SERE0015, It is an error to use the HTML output method when > appears within a processing instruction in the data model instance being serialized.
ERROR: err:SEPM0016, It is a an error if a parameter value is invalid for the defined domain.
(: http://www.w3.org/TR/xquery/#id-errors :)
ERROR: err:XPST0001, It is a static error if analysis of an expression relies on some component of the static context that has not been assigned a value.
=ERROR: err:XPDY0002, It is a dynamic error if evaluation of an expression relies on some part of the dynamic context that has not been assigned a value. illegal reference to context node: at (0,0-0,0): ``.'\'\'' is unbound
=ERROR: err:XPST0003, It is a static error if an expression is not a valid instance of the grammar defined in A.1 EBNF. syntax error, ... parse error: XQuery parsing failed
=ERROR: err:XPTY0004, It is a type error if, during the static analysis phase, an expression is found to have a static type that is not appropriate for the context in which the expression occurs, or during the dynamic evaluation phase, the dynamic type of a value does not match a required type as specified by the matching rules in 2.5.4 SequenceType Matching. ERROR: err:XPTY0004: cast to '\''%s'\'' does not allow empty sequences to be casted. ERROR: err:XPTY0004: illegal qname '\''...'\'' ERROR: err:XPTY0004: name expression expects only string, untypedAtomic, or qname value [(got empty sequence)]. ERROR: err:XPTY0004: order by expression expects at most one value. [err:XPTY0004] Orderspec requires an type whose order can be decided using '\''gt'\'' (given: ...). [err:XPTY0004] Orderspec requires at most one atomic item (given: ...).
=ERROR: err:XPST0005, During the analysis phase, it is a static error if the static type assigned to an expression other than the expression () or data(()) is empty-sequence(). ERROR: path steps are only supported starting from non-attribute nodes
ERROR: err:XPTY0006, (Not currently used.)
ERROR: err:XPTY0007, (Not currently used.)
=ERROR: err:XPST0008, It is a static error if an expression refers to an element name, attribute name, schema type name, namespace prefix, or variable name that is not defined in the static context, except within an ElementTest or an AttributeTest. variable(s) out of scope or unknown: at (0,0-0,0): ... variable(s) out of scope or unknown: erroneous variable references reported above
ERROR: err:XQST0009, An implementation that does not support the Schema Import Feature must raise a static error if a Prolog contains a schema import.
ERROR: err:XPST0010, An implementation must raise a static error if it encounters a reference to an axis that it does not support.
ERROR: err:XQST0012, It is a static error if the set of definitions contained in all schemas imported by a Prolog do not satisfy the conditions for schema validity specified in Sections 3 and 5 of [XML Schema] Part 1--i.e., each definition must be valid, complete, and unique.
ERROR: err:XQST0013, It is a static error if an implementation recognizes a pragma but determines that its content is invalid.
ERROR: err:XQST0014, (Not currently used.)
ERROR: err:XQST0015, (Not currently used.)
ERROR: err:XQST0016, An implementation that does not support the Module Feature raises a static error if it encounters a module declaration or a module import.
=ERROR: err:XPST0017, It is a static error if the expanded QName and number of arguments in a function call do not match the name and arity of a function signature in the static context. error in function application: at (0,0-0,0): wrong number of arguments for function `...'\'' (expected ..., got ...)
ERROR: err:XPTY0018, It is a type error if the result of the last step in a path expression contains both nodes and atomic values.
=ERROR: err:XPTY0019, It is a type error if the result of a step (other than the last step) in a path expression contains an atomic value. ERROR: err:XP0019: Argument to location step must be a node sequence.
ERROR: err:XPTY0020, It is a type error if, in an axis step, the context item is not a node.
ERROR: err:XPDY0021, (Not currently used.)
ERROR: err:XQST0022, It is a static error if the value of a namespace declaration attribute is not a URILiteral.
ERROR: err:XQTY0023, (Not currently used.)
=ERROR: err:XQTY0024, It is a type error if the content sequence in an element constructor contains an attribute node following a node that is not an attribute node. ERROR: err:XQTY0024: an attribute node cannot be created after the children of the containing element
=ERROR: err:XQDY0025, It is a dynamic error if any attribute of a constructed element does not have a name that is distinct from the names of all other attributes of the constructed element. ERROR: err:XQDY0025: attribute names are not unique [in constructed element] ...
ERROR: err:XQDY0026, It is a dynamic error if the result of the content expression of a computed processing instruction constructor contains the string "?>".
ERROR: err:XQDY0027, In a validate expression, it is a dynamic error if the root element information item in the PSVI resulting from validation does not have the expected validity property: valid if validation mode is strict, or either valid or notKnown if validation mode is lax.
ERROR: err:XQTY0028, (Not currently used.)
ERROR: err:XQDY0029, (Not currently used.)
ERROR: err:XQTY0030, It is a type error if the argument of a validate expression does not evaluate to exactly one document or element node.
ERROR: err:XQST0031, It is a static error if the version number specified in a version declaration is not supported by the implementation.
ERROR: err:XQST0032, A static error is raised if a Prolog contains more than one base URI declaration.
ERROR: err:XQST0033, It is a static error if a Prolog contains multiple declarations for the same namespace prefix.
ERROR: err:XQST0034, It is a static error if multiple functions declared or imported by a module have the number of arguments and their expanded QNames are equal (as defined by the eq operator).
ERROR: err:XQST0035, It is a static error to import two schema components that both define the same name in the same symbol space and in the same scope.
ERROR: err:XQST0036, It is a static error to import a module if the importing module's in-scope schema types do not include definitions for the schema type names that appear in the declarations of variables and functions (whether in an argument type or return type) that are present in the imported module and are referenced in the importing module.
ERROR: err:XQST0037, (Not currently used.)
ERROR: err:XQST0038, It is a static error if a Prolog contains more than one default collation declaration, or the value specified by a default collation declaration is not present in statically known collations.
ERROR: err:XQST0039, It is a static error for a function declaration to have more than one parameter with the same name.
ERROR: err:XQST0040, It is a static error if the attributes specified by a direct element constructor do not have distinct expanded QNames.
ERROR: err:XQDY0041, It is a dynamic error if the value of the name expression in a computed processing instruction constructor cannot be cast to the type xs:NCName.
ERROR: err:XQST0042, (Not currently used.)
ERROR: err:XQST0043, (Not currently used.)
ERROR: err:XQDY0044, It is a dynamic error if the node-name property of the node constructed by a computed attribute constructor is in the namespace http://www.w3.org/2000/xmlns/ (corresponding to namespace prefix xmlns), or is in no namespace and has local name xmlns.
ERROR: err:XQST0045, It is a static error if the function name in a function declaration is in one of the following namespaces: http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace, http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema, http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance, http://www.w3.org/2005/xpath-functions, http://www.w3.org/2005/xpath-datatypes.
ERROR: err:XQST0046, An implementation MAY raise a static error if the value of a URILiteral is of nonzero length and is not in the lexical space of xs:anyURI, or if it is a string that represents a "relative reference" as defined in [RFC3986].
ERROR: err:XQST0047, It is a static error if multiple module imports in the same Prolog specify the same target namespace.
ERROR: err:XQST0048, It is a static error if a function or variable declared in a library module is not in the target namespace of the library module.
ERROR: err:XQST0049, It is a static error if two or more variables declared or imported by a module have equal expanded QNames (as defined by the eq operator.)
ERROR: err:XPDY0050, It is a dynamic error if the dynamic type of the operand of a treat expression does not match the sequence type specified by the treat expression. This error might also be raised by a path expression beginning with "/" or "//" if the context node is not in a tree that is rooted at a document node. This is because a leading "/" or "//" in a path expression is an abbreviation for an initial step that includes the clause treat as document-node().
ERROR: err:XPST0051, It is a static error if a QName that is used as an AtomicType in a SequenceType is not defined in the in-scope schema types as an atomic type.
ERROR: err:XQDY0052, (Not currently used.)
ERROR: err:XQST0053, (Not currently used.)
ERROR: err:XQST0054, It is a static error if the initializing expression in a variable declaration cannot be executed because of a circularity (for example, the expression depends on a function that in turn depends on the value of the initialized variable).
ERROR: err:XQST0055, It is a static error if a Prolog contains more than one copy-namespaces declaration.
ERROR: err:XQST0056, (Not currently used.)
ERROR: err:XQST0057, It is a static error if a schema import binds a namespace prefix but does not specify a target namespace other than a zero-length string.
ERROR: err:XQST0058, It is a static error if multiple schema imports specify the same target namespace.
ERROR: err:XQST0059, It is a static error if an implementation is unable to process a schema or module import by finding a schema or module with the specified target namespace.
ERROR: err:XQST0060, It is a static error if the name of a function in a function declaration is not in a namespace (expanded QName has a null namespace URI).
ERROR: err:XQDY0061, It is a dynamic error if the operand of a validate expression is a document node whose children do not consist of exactly one element node and zero or more comment and processing instruction nodes, in any order.
ERROR: err:XQDY0062, (Not currently used.)
ERROR: err:XQST0063, (Not currently used.)
ERROR: err:XQDY0064, It is a dynamic error if the value of the name expression in a computed processing instruction constructor is equal to "XML" (in any combination of upper and lower case).
ERROR: err:XQST0065, A static error is raised if a Prolog contains more than one ordering mode declaration.
ERROR: err:XQST0066, A static error is raised if a Prolog contains more than one default element/type namespace declaration, or more than one default function namespace declaration.
ERROR: err:XQST0067, A static error is raised if a Prolog contains more than one construction declaration.
ERROR: err:XQST0068, A static error is raised if a Prolog contains more than one boundary-space declaration.
ERROR: err:XQST0069, A static error is raised if a Prolog contains more than one empty order declaration.
ERROR: err:XQST0070, A static error is raised if the predefined namespace prefix xml or xmlns is redeclared or if another namespace prefix is bound to the namespace URI associated with the prefix xml.
ERROR: err:XQST0071, A static error is raised if the namespace declaration attributes of a direct element constructor do not have distinct names.
ERROR: err:XQDY0072, It is a dynamic error if the result of the content expression of a computed comment constructor contains two adjacent hyphens or ends with a hyphen.
ERROR: err:XQST0073, It is a static error if the graph of module imports contains a cycle (that is, if there exists a sequence of modules M1 ... Mn such that each Mi imports Mi+1 and Mn imports M1), unless all the modules in the cycle share a common namespace.
ERROR: err:XQDY0074, It is a dynamic error if the value of the name expression in a computed element or attribute constructor cannot be converted to an expanded QName (for example, because it contains a namespace prefix not found in statically known namespaces.)
ERROR: err:XQST0075, An implementation that does not support the Validation Feature must raise a static error if it encounters a validate expression.
ERROR: err:XQST0076, It is a static error if a collation subclause in an order by clause of a FLWOR expression does not identify a collation that is present in statically known collations.
ERROR: err:XQST0077, (Not currently used.)
ERROR: err:XQST0078, (Not currently used.)
ERROR: err:XQST0079, It is a static error if an extension expression contains neither a pragma that is recognized by the implementation nor an expression enclosed in curly braces.
=ERROR: err:XPST0080, The target type of a cast or castable expression must be an atomic type that is in the in-scope schema types and is not xs:NOTATION or xs:anyAtomicType, optionally followed by the occurrence indicator "?"; otherwise a static error is raised. type error: casting is only allowed to an atomic type
=ERROR: err:XPST0081, It is a static error if a QName used in a query contains a namespace prefix that cannot be expanded into a namespace URI by using the statically known namespaces. bad usage of XML namespaces: at ...
ERROR: err:XQST0082, (Not currently used.)
ERROR: err:XPST0083, (Not currently used.)
ERROR: err:XQDY0084, It is a dynamic error if the element validated by a validate statement does not have a top-level element declaration in the in-scope element declarations, if validation mode is strict.
ERROR: err:XQST0085, It is a static error if the namespace URI in a namespace declaration attribute is a zero-length string, and the implementation does not support [XML Names 1.1].
ERROR: err:XQTY0086, It is a type error if the typed value of a copied element or attribute node is namespace-sensitive when construction mode is preserve and copy-namespaces mode is no-preserve.
ERROR: err:XQST0087, It is a static error if the encoding specified in a Version Declaration does not conform to the definition of EncName specified in [XML 1.0].
ERROR: err:XQST0088, It is a static error if the literal that specifies the target namespace in a module import or a module declaration is of zero length.
ERROR: err:XQST0089, It is a static error if a variable bound in a for clause of a FLWOR expression, and its associated positional variable, do not have distinct names (expanded QNames).
ERROR: err:XQST0090, It is a static error if a character reference does not identify a valid character in the version of XML that is in use.
